methods.isLegalNamespaceName:
Validates whether a given name is a valid namespace.

*Overload 1*  
  :param name: (java.lang.String) - the name to validate
  :param customReplace: (java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>) - a function that is applied to the name before processing legality
  :param takenNames: (java.util.Set<java.lang.String>) - the list of names that are already taken
  :return: (boolean) whether the name is valid for a new namespace
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param name: java.lang.String
  :return: boolean
  
*Overload 3*  
  :param name: java.lang.String
  :param takenNames: java.util.Set<java.lang.String>
  :return: boolean
  
*Overload 4*  
  :param name: java.lang.String
  :param replaceCustom: java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>
  :return: boolean
methods.isLegalTableName:
Validates whether a given name is a legal table name.

*Overload 1*  
  :param name: java.lang.String
  :return: boolean
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param name: java.lang.String
  :param takenNames: java.util.Set<java.lang.String>
  :return: boolean
  
*Overload 3*  
  :param name: java.lang.String
  :param replaceCustom: java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>
  :return: boolean
  
*Overload 4*  
  :param name: (java.lang.String) - the name to validate
  :param customReplace: (java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>) - a function that is applied to the name before processing legality
  :param takenNames: (java.util.Set<java.lang.String>) - the list of names that are already taken
  :return: (boolean) whether the name is valid for a new table
methods.legalizeColumnName:
Attempts to return a legal name based on the passed in name.

 
 Illegal characters are simply removed. Custom replacement is possible through
 customReplace

 To avoid duplicated names, anything in the set takenNames will not be returned. These
 duplicates are resolved by adding sequential digits at the end of the variable name.

 
 Column names A variable's name can be any legal identifier - an unlimited-length sequence of
 Unicode letters and digits, beginning with a letter, the dollar sign "$", or the underscore
 character "_". Subsequent characters may be letters, digits, dollar signs, or underscore
 characters.

*Overload 1*  
  :param name: java.lang.String
  :return: java.lang.String
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param name: java.lang.String
  :param takenNames: java.util.Set<java.lang.String>
  :return: java.lang.String
  
*Overload 3*  
  :param name: java.lang.String
  :param replaceCustom: java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>
  :return: java.lang.String
  
*Overload 4*  
  :param name: (java.lang.String) - , customReplace, takenNames can not be null
  :param customReplace: java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>
  :param takenNames: java.util.Set<java.lang.String>
  :return: java.lang.String

  :return: java.lang.String[]

methods.legalizeQueryParameterName:
Attempts to return a legal name based on the passed in name.

 
 Illegal characters are simply removed. Custom replacement is possible through
 customReplace

 To avoid duplicated names, anything in the set takenNames will not be returned. These
 duplicates are resolved by adding sequential digits at the end of the variable name.

 
 Query parameters follow the same rules as column names
